alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 4:08PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Weld, Morgan, north central Washington, Logan and northwestern Sedgwick Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 406 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms in Morgan, northeast Weld, and Logan counties moving northeast at 30 mph. The strongest storms are capable of producing brief heavy rain, wind gusts to 50 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Fort Morgan, Brush, Log Lane Village, Fleming, Merino, Iliff, Hillrose, Peetz, Crook, Prewitt Reservoir, Padroni, Atwood, Twelve-Mile Corner, Stoneham, Westplains, Snyder, Midway, Gary and Hoyt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
